intro: Wormskioldia hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. The plant belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent foliage and specialized adaptations to arid environments. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Wormskioldia hildebrandtii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
